means: 交出，让给( relinquish的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She has relinquished the post to her cousin, Sir Edward.
sentence.Network_cn: 她把职位让给了表弟爱德华爵士.

sentence.Network_en: The small dog relinquished his bone to the big dog.
sentence.Network_cn: 小狗把它的骨头让给那只大狗.

sentence.Network_en: He's relinquished his claim to the throne.
sentence.Network_cn: 他放弃了继承王位的要求.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 1. 当创建备份时,  任何数据库客户端希望写入数据库文件时,都必须等待,知道共享锁被放弃(relinquished)2. 不能与内存数据库交换数.
Yet Beijing has not relinquished all control of the renminbi in Hong Kong ., 不过 , 中国政府并没有完全放弃对香港人民币业务的控制.
To lessen the pain , some people chose relinquished responsibility ., 为了减少痛苦 , 有些人选择放弃所有责任.
as a result America relinquished the Jim Crow laws and saw many other groups press for their individual rights as well .结果，美国人放弃了吉姆·克罗斯法并观看许多其它集团表达他们的个人权利。

list.abs: refuge 避难所relinquishing mother 放弃责任的母亲restraining order 限制令
relinquish 放弃; 撤回; 停止; 放弃,废除; relinquish to 让与; 让与权力; 财产; relinquish power 交出权力; formally relinquish 正式放弃(权力、高位等〕.
upon entering the physical universe , you relinquished your remembrance of yourself .在进入物质宇宙时，你放弃了对自己的记忆。
i had relinquished all hope that she was alive ., 我已经放弃了她还活着的一切希望.

entry.def: If you relinquish something such as power or control, you give it up.

example.ex: He does not intend to relinquish power.

means.word_mean: 1. that has been withdrawn or retreated from

sentences.sentence: "a relinquishment is a piece of relinquished or abandoned land"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: God relinquished a measure of his own sovereignty.
